Linde Gas  Inc. Executive Summary :

The site has Anhydrous Ammonia on the site stored in a Bulk Tank in a quantity greater than the 112(R) list thresold quantity.

If a release or an accident would occur there would be no impact on public receptors per modeling conducted by Imes Engineering Inc., for the worst case and alternative release scenarios . This modeling was performed in 1998 and still holds true today where no process changes have occured and the nearest pubic receptor has'nt change.

There have not been an accidential release involving the requlated substance within the past five years and Linde has sheared our emergency action plan with the local responders . 

Base on the above information the the two processes mention :

- Ammonia used as a refrigerant in the CO2 Liquefaction process

- Ammonia used as an on site Nox Reducing Agent to control emissions from our Flue Gas 

Are concidered program level 1 processes .



Accidential Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at the Decatur Linde Gas Inc. Facility:

Safety has always been the first consideration in the design and operation of this plant. Nevertheless there is always the possibility of equipment failure, operator error or force of nature which could cause a serious environmental problem. Linde Gas llc is committed to making protection of human heath,safety and the environment our first priority. We will operate on the premise that all accidents and incidents are preventable and work toward this goal . Linde Gas llc Decatur will fulfill this policy commitment through the application of a comprehensive Risk Management System which will provide all stakeholders with ongoing assurance that :

- Safety ,heath and environmental laws  , regulations , and permit requirements ae adhered to

- Identifiable safety,heath and environmental risks associated with Linde Gas LLC Decatur operation are assessed and successfully managed

- Systems are in place to manage change 

- An environmental co

ntigency plan is in Place

- An Emergency Response Procedure is in place 

- An excellent safety performance is everyone's responsibility, and it is this site policey that all employees must adopt and are encourage safe work practices and conduct for all work related activites in an environmentally responsible manner.

General Information of the facility :

Linde Gas llc hydrogen gas generation plant and liquid carbon dioxide recovery unit in Decatur Alabama provide hydrogen feed stock for pipeline distribution to Bunge Foods, BP Amoco , and Worthington and serve as a suplemental sourse to Solutia . The maufacturing process includes taking natural gas as the feed stock, mixing it with steam , after which is preheated then pass  through a reformer where the methane and water mix is converted to hydrogen ,Carbon Monoxide and Carbon Dioxoide.

The reformer gas is then pass through to a high temperature shift convertor where the carbon monoxide will be reacted with excess steam present in the gas stream to produce additional hydrogen by the following reaction :

CO + H2O = CO2 + H2

The gas then is cooled and CO2 is stripped off and sent to a CO2 Liquefaction process before being transfer to storage for Distribution . The hydrogen is pass through a high pressure purification step from which it is transfer directly to clients by way of pipeline. 

Regulated Substance Handled at the site : 

Anhydrous Ammonia is used in two areas of the site :

1) Ammonia is used as a refrigerent in the CO2 Liquefaction pocess to convert CO2 from the gas to the Liquid state. The refrigerent package is a close loop system that contains approximately 4500 lbs of Ammonia at any one time.

2) Ammonia is also used on our site as a reducing Agent to reduce the amount of nitrogen oxide emmision from our process flue gas. The site uses a Selective Catalytic and a Non- Catalytic reduction system design specific to reduce nitrogen oxide from exust gases . 

Auxillary euipment supporting the Nitroge

n Oxide reduction system icludes a 10,000 gallon Ammonia storage tank , Deluge system for the tank , collection system for spills , welded transfer pipe , and a software control system .

The system make use of the anhydrous ammonia by diluting it to approximately five percent with abient air then injecting the mixture in the flue gas stream where the temperature is approx 1700 F FOR Non catalytic reduction and up stream of Catalyst for NOX Catalytic reduction . The face temperature of the catalyst runs around 500 - 700 F . The reaction that occurs results in the Nitrogen Oxide being reduce to Nitrogen and water vapor.

The Worst-case release scenario and the alternative release scenario for Anhydrous Ammonia at the Linde Gas llc Decatur Site:

Introduction : The Analysis was performed on the 10,000 gallon Ammonia Storage Tank that is located on the southeast corner of our facility. The location itself is a peninsula of land surrounded by Wheeler lake on the north east and south  side . The models focused on the area to the west where other facilities are located and on the site control building.

The Models were run on PHAST Professional , Version 5.1. This product of DVN Technica is widely used for air modeling applications.

The scope of the analysis included modeling a worst case release scenario of a vessel rupture and an alternative release scenario of lifting relief valves . 

Worst -Case Release :

The worst case release scenario was performed following federal Risk Management Plan ( RPM) guidelines. 

The Following parameters were used ( per 40 CFR 68 OF RMP ) :

- Wind speed of 3.4 mi/hr and an atmospheric stability class of F .

- Ambient Temperature of 77 F

- Relative Humididty of 50%

- Ground level release of 0 feet

- Surface roughness of 0.17 

For Toxic exposure , The Emergency Response Planning Guideline ( EPRG) 2 levels were used . This level is equivalent to 200 ppm ammonia . Three approximated distances were used in the calculations. The first

distance of 200 ft is the approximate distance to the west fence line and to the control building. The second distance of 600ft represents the southeast corner of the Solutia Facility . The third distance of 1600 ft corresponds to the Nova Chemical eastern property line. The Nova Chemical Property line was the major area of concern .

The following assumptions were made : 

- The vessel is 80% full ( 8000 gal ) . This corresponds to 39020 lbs of ammonia 

- The vessel is within a concrete dike area of 15 ft by 45 ft

- The vessel inventory empties into dike area over a 10 min peroid ( 3902 gal / min ). This is typical for ammonia rupture scenario

- The Ammonia in the vessel is pressurized to 180 psig , with a corresponding temperature of 94.8 F

-No mitigation credit is taken while vessel empties ( deluge not activated ) 

Summary of Results :

The results of the study showed that the plume becomes buoyant and detaches from the ground at a distance of roughly 60 ft . At a distance of 1600 ft the plume has a centerline concentration of 2446 ppm,but this concentration is at a height of 90ft . The erpg 2 level of 200 ppm is reached at a distance of 4023 ft and a plume height of 204 feet . Base on these results a vessel rupture would have no impact on the Nova Chemical property at ground level .

On site impacts for this scenario are of a concern . At this distance of 200ft ( Approximately control room distance ) , The plume centerline concentration is estimated to be 357,147 ppm . At this distance ,the plume is less than 1 ft from the ground .

Alternative Release Scenario :

The alternative release scenario involved relief of the vessel contents from 2"x3" relief valves.

The alternative release scenario was performed following Risk Management Plan Guidelines . 

The following parameters were used ( per 40 CFR 68 OF RMP ):

- Wind speed of 8.6 mi/hr and an atmospheric stability class  of F

-Ambient Temperature of 73 F

- Relative Humity of 80%

-Surface roughness of

0.17

Once again ERPG 2 Levels were used and the same distance of interest ( 200,600,1600 ft ) were calculated 

The Following Assumtions were made :

- To capture the worst case scenario , two relief valves were assumed to be relieving simultaneously .Since PHAST Does not allow input into the case directly , one relief valve was modeled and the orfice and tail pipe size were adjusted to simulate two relief valves lifting .

- The vessel is 80% full ( 80,000 gal) . This corresponds to approximately 39,020 lbs of Ammonia 

- The relief valves relieve at 265 psig  , with a corresponding temperature of 119 F 

- The release height was 15 ft , which included a 5ft stand pipe 

Summary of Results 

The calculated release rate was 615 lbs/min . The ERPG 2 concentration of 200 ppm was reached at a distance of 568 ft. At this distance the cloud is still buoyant and has not touched down. The cloud edge touches down at a distance of 975 ft and is 200 ppm . At 1600ft , the centerline concentration is 49 ppm, which is well below the allowed 200 ppm . This relief valve scenario would have no on site impact what so ever . Base on these results , the current vessel and relief valve configuation is adequate to protect the Nova Chemical Property from ERGP 2 Ammonia concentrations.

General Accidential Release Prevention Program and Chemical - Specific Prevention Steps:

Linde Gas LLC , Decatur Plant Process is designed and operated under strick parameters to reduce risk of accidents. The safety of Linde Gas employees and the citizens of the surrounding communities are of paramount importance. As a result of Linde gas commitment to the safety of its employees , Its surrounding community , to to fully comply with OSHA 'S standard 29 cfr 1910.119 ( Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals ) Linde Gas has a Process Safety Management Program ( PSM ) . This Program is intended to prevent or reduced the risk of any major industrial incident that might expose employees to th

e Hazard of Toxicity,Fire,or explosion cause by highly hazardous chemicals.

The elements of the program are :

1.  Employee Participation 
2.  Process Safety Information 
3.  Process Hazard Analysis
4  Operating Procedure
5. Training
6. Contractor Safety
7. Pre-Startup Safety Review
8. Mechanical Integrity
9. Hot Work Permit
10. Management Of Change
11. Incident Investigation 
12. Emergency Response Plan
13. Complience Audit 
14 Trade Secrets

The objective of these provisions is to develop a protective approach to the identification , evaluation, and prevention of chemical releases which result from lack of procedures,human error , or equipment failure.

Linde Gas LLC has also developed and implemented a Best Management Prctice Plan prevents or minimize the potential for release of pollutants from ancillary activities , including material storage areas ; plant site runoff ; inplant transfer ,  process and material handling areas ; loading and unloading operations to the waters of the State.

The ammonia storage areas are all in dike areas equiped with sumps that pump to a holding tank for testing. The 10,000 gallon Ammonia tank has an added deluge protective featue that can be operated at a safe distance in the control room. Wind socks are also located within the site to determine wind direction. An emergency response plan is in place .

The Five Year Accident History :

The site has not had an accidential release since its start up on September 1998


The Emergency Response Program :

The intent of the management at this site is to be pro-active , reduce risk , provide a safe , healthy work site and prevent accidents and emergencies from ocurring as much as feasible . The Emergency Action Plan is developed to minimize threats to life , health and property when unplan events happen .

The Emegency Response Program was developed base on the following Assumptions:

1.  There are few locations in the plant at which personel are highly concentrated 
2.  Operarions in

the plant may be isolated on short notice from other sections
3.  Personnel are trained operators who understand their section of the plant thoroughly and who have been trained on steps to be taken to assure safe operation in that section
4. Damage to one section of the plant by fire, explosion or other catastrophic failure can be limited to that section 

Linde Gas LLC Decatur in the event of an incident would need to rely on assistanse from the Decatur Fire Department and local law enforcement . The existance of an emergency will be reported immediately by any individual calling 911 . In oder that the 911 officer realizes the urgency of the call , the individual reporting will state " emergency call" . Facts to be reported to the 911 officer will enclude the following :

- Name of the individule making the report 
- Where the call is being made from 
- Nature of occurrence 
- Weather there has been loss of life or injury to personel 

If the incident involves a release the proper Emergency Release Notifications must also be made:

- Morgan County EMA
- State Emergency Response Commission
- National Response Center 

Further information that must be provided would include the following:

- Name of chemical release 
- Estimated Quantity release 
- Time and duration of release 
- Release occured in air , water or land 
- Known or anticipated acute or chronic health risks and where appropriate ,advice concerning medical attention necessary for expose personel 
- Proper precautions to take as result of release including evacuations:

In House Training of Personel Includes:

1) Scott Air Pack Training by The Fire Department 
2) CPR Training From Red Cross
3) First Aid from Red Cross
4) Proper Use of Fire Extinqesher . Training Video . Note : Training the first time was performed by the fire department 
5) Yearly Site Review of Emergency Action Plan 
6) Yearly review of Environmental Plan 
7) Monthly Safety Meetings where the site go over corrective actions to take for a

specific emergency situation 

Other Elements included in the Emergency Action Plan : 

1) An emergency escape procedure and emergency escape assignment
2) Procedures to be followed by employees who remain to operate critical plant operations before they evacuate 
3)Procedures to account for all employees after an emergency evacuation has been completed 
4) First aid duty assignment for first man on the scene 
5) An Alarm system test schedule 

Fire Prevention Elements include :

1) Hot Work Permit 
2)House Keeping Policey
3)Nitrogen Blanket on AFT Day Tank . ( Combustible Oil )
